Traceability Matrix: Blah 1.06

Scope

This traceability matrix links requirement specifications and test results to specific user stories for the proposed software release. User stories, including requirements and test specifications, are listed in the Requirements Specification.

User Story Test ID
User should be able to use the based_on field to unambiguously refer to models, even in cases where nested directories may contain different models with the same base filename. BLAH-020 BLAH-021 BLAH-023 BLAH-024 BLAH-025 BLAH-026 BLAH-027 BLAH-028 BLAH-030 BLAH-031 BLAH-032 BLAH-080 BLAH-081 BLAH-082 BLAH-083 BLAH-084 BLAH-085 BLAH-102 BLAH-113 BLAH-115
A user can use either a .yaml or .yml file for the model file. BLAH-065 BLAH-066 BLAH-067 BLAH-068 BLAH-094 BLAH-095 BLAH-101 BLAH-121 BLAH-122
The user should only need to create one babylon.yaml configuration file, and it should be found by all bbi calls that need it automatically (if it is in the model directory). BLAH-145 BLAH-146 BLAH-147 BLAH-148 BLAH-149 BLAH-156 BLAH-157 BLAH-158 BLAH-159 BLAH-160 BLAH-161 BLAH-162 BLAH-163 BLAH-164 BLAH-165 BLAH-166 BLAH-167 BLAH-168 BLAH-169 BLAH-170 BLAH-171 BLAH-172 BLAH-173
A user should be able to call copy_model_from() without worrying about accidentally overwriting an existing model file. BLAH-017 BLAH-018
The model YAML must serve as a “source of truth” for the data that it stores about the model. The user needs to be sure that any model object held in memory is up-to-date with the YAML on disk. BLAH-086 BLAH-087 BLAH-088 BLAH-089 BLAH-090 BLAH-091 BLAH-092
